snippet: The Obama administration is backpedaling on a key nonproliferation provision in nuclear cooperation agreements.
abstract: Editorial asserts that the Obama administration has retreated from its firm stance on the spread of nuclear technology by failing to insist that countries with which the United States signs nuclear cooperation agreements refrain from enriching uranium and reprocessing plutonium; urges it to make curbing the spread of this technology an explicit priority.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is backpedaling on a key nonproliferation provision in nuclear cooperation agreements.

headline.seo: Shall We Call It the ‘Bronze Standard’?
headline.main: Shall We Call It the ‘Bronze Standard’?
headline.print_headline: Shall We Call It the ‘Bronze Standard’?
